Problem 37. What is the smallest subset of N containing, for each d = 1, . . . , N,
an arithmetic progression of length k with common difference d?
Comments. Writing Fk(N) for this quantity, it is conjectured that Fk(N) ≫k
N 1−ck, with ck →0 as k →∞. One should not expect this problem to be easy,
as it was shown by Ruzsa and me [146] to be equivalent to the so-called arith-
metic Kakeya conjecture of Katz and Tao (which implies the Kakeya conjecture in
Euclidean space).
